keyMoments.title: Joy Boy First Mentioned
keyMoments.description: Nico Robin discovers Joy Boy's name while reading the Poneglyph in the Sea Forest. The Poneglyph contains an apology from Joy Boy to the people of Fish-Man Island for failing to keep a promise made during the Void Century.
keyMoments.significance: First introduction of Joy Boy, a mysterious figure from the Void Century who becomes crucial to understanding the series' ultimate mysteries and Luffy's destiny.
keyMoments.quote: This is an apology... from someone named Joy Boy.

reveals.information: Joy Boy existed during the Void Century and made a promise to Fish-Man Island
Joy Boy left an apology on a Poneglyph for failing to fulfill his promise

keyMoments.title: Togare's Debut
keyMoments.description: Togare, a fish-man resident of Coral Hill, appears among the citizens caught up in Hody Jones's coup and forced desecration of Queen Otohime's memorial.
keyMoments.significance: Represents the ordinary Fish-Man Island citizens affected by Hody's violent takeover.

reveals.information: Lives in Coral Hill on Fish-Man Island

keyMoments.title: Gotan's Debut
keyMoments.description: Gotan is mentioned as one of the citizens whose name appears on Queen Otohime's petition, marking him as a supporter of peace between humans and fish-men and therefore a target of Hody Jones.
keyMoments.significance: Represents the Fish-Man Island citizens who supported Otohime's vision and are now persecuted by Hody's regime.

reveals.information: Signed Queen Otohime's petition for peace with humans

keyMoments.title: Robin Discovers Joy Boy's Apology
keyMoments.description: Robin deciphers the Poneglyph in the Sea Forest and discovers it contains an apology from Joy Boy. This reveals the existence of an ancient promise made to Fish-Man Island during the Void Century.
keyMoments.significance: Robin's unique ability to read Poneglyphs unveils crucial information about Joy Boy and ancient history, furthering the overarching mystery of the series.
keyMoments.quote: This is an apology... from someone named Joy Boy.

name.japanese: ホーディ・ジョーンズ

keyMoments.title: Hody's Coup Broadcast
keyMoments.description: Hody broadcasts his takeover plan across all of Fish-Man Island, announcing King Neptune's execution and declaring himself the new ruler of the Ryugu Kingdom.
keyMoments.significance: Hody's public declaration marks the full escalation of his coup and forces a direct confrontation with the Straw Hats.
keyMoments.quote: In three hours, I will execute King Neptune at Gyoncorde Plaza! I will become the new king of the Ryugu Kingdom!

keyMoments.title: Forcing Citizens to Desecrate Otohime's Memorial
keyMoments.description: Hody forces Fish-Man Island citizens to step on portraits of Queen Otohime, threatening death to those who refuse, completely rejecting her vision of peace.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Hody's tyrannical methods and complete opposition to human-fishman coexistence.

keyMoments.title: Threatens Straw Hat Execution
keyMoments.description: Hody announces his intention to execute the captured Straw Hat Pirates as examples to all surface humans.
keyMoments.significance: Directly threatens Luffy's crew and forces the conflict to become personal.
keyMoments.quote: The Straw Hats will serve as an example to all humans from the surface. They will be executed!

keyMoments.title: Luffy Disagrees with Jinbe
keyMoments.description: Luffy insists on fighting Hody Jones to save his crew despite Jinbe's concerns about worsening human-fishman relations. Their disagreement begins to escalate into conflict.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Luffy's unwavering loyalty to his crew above all political considerations, setting up his clash with Jinbe.
keyMoments.quote: I don't care about that! My crew is in danger!

keyMoments.title: Jinbe Opposes Luffy's Intervention
keyMoments.description: Jinbe opposes Luffy fighting Hody Jones, fearing that human involvement will increase resentment toward Fish-Men and dishonor Queen Otohime's legacy. His opposition begins to escalate into a confrontation with Luffy.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Jinbe's concern for the broader implications of the conflict and the fragile state of human-fishman relations.

keyMoments.title: Neptune's Execution Announced
keyMoments.description: King Neptune is held captive as Hody Jones broadcasts that he will be executed in three hours at Gyoncorde Plaza as part of Hody's coup.
keyMoments.significance: Neptune's impending execution serves as the catalyst for the climactic battle at Gyoncorde Plaza.

keyMoments.title: Neptune Contemplates Joy Boy's Promise
keyMoments.description: Neptune reflects on the ancient promise made by Joy Boy, a legend passed down through the royal family about someone who will one day fulfill the promise.
keyMoments.significance: Reveals that the royal family has been guarding knowledge of Joy Boy's promise for generations.

reveals.information: Neptune knows about Joy Boy's ancient promise through royal family legend
